distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for curl is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The curl packages provide the libcurl library and the curl utility for downloading files from servers using various protocols, including HTTP, FTP, and LDAP.

Security Fix(es):

* It was found that the fix for CVE-2015-3148 in curl was incomplete. An application using libcurl with HTTP Negotiate authentication could incorrectly re-use credentials for subsequent requests to the same server. (CVE-2017-2628)

This issue was discovered by Paulo Andrade (Red Hat).
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: curl security update

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: It was found that the fix for CVE-2015-3148 in curl was incomplete. An application using libcurl with HTTP Negotiate authentication could incorrectly re-use credentials for subsequent requests to the same server.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2017-2628 curl: negotiate not treated as connection-oriented (incomplete fix for CVE-2015-3148)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2017-2628 curl: negotiate not treated as connection-oriented (incomplete fix for CVE-2015-3148)
